docs.text: david cronenberg presents us with another strange tale crawling out of his impressively twisted head .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is one of many science fiction films , released during the last year of this millenium , that tackles issues that will play an important role in our future .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story unfolds in a near future , where the line between reality and virtual reality blurs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the world of the future is an unfriendly place , where the scared inhabitants are " hiding " in virtual reality fantasy games to escape the uncertainty of the real world .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: allegra geller ( jennifer jason leigh ) , the leading game designer in the world , is testing her new virtual reality game , existenz with a focus group .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as they begin , she is attacked by a fanatic assassin employing a bizarre organic gun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she flees with a young marketing trainee , ted pikul ( jude law ) , who is suddenly assigned as her bodyguard .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , her pod , an organic gaming device that contains the only copy of the existenz game program , is damaged .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to inspect it , she talks ted into accepting a gameport in his own body so he can play the game with her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the events leading up to this , and the resulting game lead the pair on a strange adventure in a world where individuality doesn't exist , as the " players " are forced to perform as characters in an unknown plot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: here the reality and their actions are impossible to determine from either their own or the game's perspective .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i don't intend to reveal more of the film's premise , which is structured as a computer game , with " tasks " that the characters must complete to win the game .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: released after " the matrix " and " dark city " , " existenz " has some similarities and parallels that connect it to these films .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , " existenz " is moving in a different direction , with a premise of its own .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a combination of dazzling special effects , brilliantly coordinated action sequences and an intelligent and sophisticated plot , made " the matrix " a rare and entertaining science fiction experience , with some dark and frightening ideas hidden under its sparkling facade .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " existenz " has a completely different atmosphere , resembling " dark city " , which is darker , more serious and less entertaining .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " existenz " has the opportunities and potential , but the enormous possibilities are never quite explored .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after the engaging beginning , it starts to falter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while i was watching the film , many left the theatre during the first hour .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and indeed , " existenz " seemed as a complete failure : the actors seemed unreal , the plot and dialogue silly , unfinished relationships and unexplained events followed one after another .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the last fifteen minutes lifted the film on a complete different level , explaining all past events , the silly dialogue and the unreal performances within a few scenes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and jet the film fails on several issues .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: probably the best written character in the story is a game designer , who would rather spend the rest of her life in a virtual world , than face real life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is a great possibility to create a magnificent character , and jennifer jason leigh stretches cronenberg's script to the limits , but fails because the advantages of virtual reality in comparison to the real world are never shown .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: existenz is not a world of which you might dream about in your fantasies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is not a world worth sacrificing your life for .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a cold , dark place where the " players " are forced to interrelate with unreal characters , eat mutated creatures and even murder against their own will .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it doesn't look like a place worth even thinking about .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: david cronenberg has been the creator of " the fly " , " videodrome " and " the dead zone " , so it's not so hard to guess that " existenz " is a violent and gory film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besides the regular murders of innocent people , the audiences can enjoy an autopsy of a two-headed mutated amfibium .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: scenes like that have become a trademark for cronenberg and it seems that he can't make a film without flowing blood and foul creatures .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the way i see it , this is the film's crucial failure .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is impossible for cronenbergto create a beautiful world where time , space and problems of our everyday life do not exist ; a place of blooming blossoms , green forests and clear waters ; a place really worth sacrificing your life for .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: because of its lack of three dimensionality , the film looses most of its possibilities , but stays afloat because of some interesting scenes , amusing performances ( especially by willem dafoe ) and one interesting and important thought , depicted in many different ways throughout the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: during the film , the audience is as confused as the characters : detached from their everyday existence and no longer able to see the difference between the real world and the alternative reality that they have created .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " the matrix " , despite of its many dark and disturbing thoughts , ends with a light at the end of the tunnel .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " existenz " does not .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is a one time experience , ending in blood , gore and madness - a rather frightening forecast for tomorrow .
docs.label: positive
